Condition 2: DJ has 8 guns, Nick has 10 guns, RJ has 1 gun, and Richard has an unusually large number of 7356661 guns. Condition 3: If they divide up their guns equally, what is the number of guns each person receives?

direct_answer.text:

DJ originally had 8 guns and each person gets x guns when they divide them up equally, so DJ's original number of guns plus the guns he loses equals the number of guns he gets when they divide them up equally:

DJ's original number of guns = DJ's number of guns when they divide them up equally

8 = x

Nick originally had 10 guns and each person gets x guns when they divide them up equally, so Nick's original number of guns plus the guns he loses equals the number of guns he gets when they divide them up equally:

10 = x

RJ originally had 1 gun and each person gets x guns when they divide them up equally, so RJ's original number of guns plus the guns he loses equals the number of guns he gets when they divide them up equally:

1 = x

Richard originally had 7356661
